chargeHist.descr: Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Nathan Lee Peterson

records.addlTxt: Plea/sentencing hearing on November 28, 2022 at 09:00 am.

10:41 AM ADA calls cases: 20CF89, 21cf66, 22CF29 and states appearances. Defendant Nathan Lee Peterson in court.  Attorney Keith Franklin Ellison appeared by video for Nathan Lee Peterson.  Attorney Mark T. Fuhr in court for State of Wisconsin. Court questions parties as to status. ADA Fuhr states an offer was sent to defense in April and at that time Attorney Ellison wanted more time to go over the offer with his client. Attorney Ellison gives statements. Court suggests the parties set these matters for Plea and Sentencing. ADA Fuhr gives a date of: 11/28/2022 at 9:00 AM. All 3 matters will be set for Plea and Sentencing on that date.
Status hearing on September 15, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Defendant enters a plea of NOT GUILTY to all counts.

9:12 AM ADA Fuhr calls cases: 20CF89, 21CF66, and 22CF29 and states appearances. Defendant Nathan Lee Peterson in court.  Attorney Keith Franklin Ellison appeared by phone for Nathan Lee Peterson.  Attorney Mark T. Fuhr in court for State of Wisconsin. ADA Fuhr states cases 20CF89 and 21CF66 are set for status hearings while case 22CF29 is set for a Preliminary Hearing. Attorney Ellison makes comments. The court notes that a waiver form was efiled a couple weeks ago. Court goes over the signed Waiver of Preliminary Form with the defendant line item by line item. Court questions Attorney Ellison in regards to the defendant's waiver. Preliminary Hearing waived.  Waiver accepted by the Court. Court finds probable cause exists that a crime was committed and binds DE over for trial. Information filed, acknowledged by parties and reading waived. Defendant enters a plea of NOT GUILTY to all counts. Attorney Ellison requests 60 days for a status hearing as there has been an offer made however the parties are working on a global solution. ADA Fuhr gives a date of 09/15/2022 at 10:30 AM for a status hearing on all 3 matters.
Instructions for How to Appear Remotely
Motion hearing on July 21, 2022 at 09:00 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Preliminary hearing on July 21, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Preliminary Hearing - Schedule or Waiver on July 21, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant may not have contact with the individual(s): J.P. unless a written waiver is filed with the Clerk of Courts Office or the Price County Sheriff's Office outside of normal business hours
  *No Contact includes: Going to or remaining in any place the individual resides, is employed at, attends school at, or any public location the individual is temporarily located. Contact through means of telephone. Electronic devices, Social media, email, regular mail, or a 3rd party individual is prohibited. The only exception to this order is contact through your attorney or law enforcement in appropriate circumstances.

10:30 AM Defendant Nathan Lee Peterson appeared with attorney Keith Franklin Ellison via telephone.  Karl J. Kelz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Complaint acknowledged, reading waived.  Preliminary hearing requested, time limits waived.  DE enters plea of NOT GUILTY to all counts.   Court orders Pre-trial conference be scheduled for 04/25/2022 at 2:00 PM
